message: yet screenr is the coolest thing ever! thanks man
do you guys know any screen recording tool that is free and good available for OSX? I am only going to record my screen, no voice

Despite my link to Jing above, Screenflow is an amazing value. Yes it's $99, but it's great software. It's worth mentioning that the free demo is full featured aside from a watermark. Here's a screencast i recently made with Screenflow: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-gshOz0uZDE
http://www.screenr.com/ is good
wow screenr looks awesome.  I've enjoyed ScreenFlow, but it's $99.  Lets you do lots of editing after recording, though.
Jing (http://www.techsmith.com/jing/free/, by the makers of Camtasia) is free + even hosts for you. You can upgrade for only $15/yr.

i enjoy screen flick a lot very good http://www.araelium.com/screenflick/ and if i need to make a quick one i use camtwist to make it a webcam and just record off that, it is a little DIY but works good
http://www.shinywhitebox.com/ishowuhd/main.html
I use the pro version because the low cpu mode is key when you're recording yourself playing minecraft:
I use the paid version of iShowU HD and it works great. Records key and mouse clicks, prefect for creating lessons.
:P
If you are running snow leopard, QuickTime has that very feature built-in already for what you're looking for.

Screenflow is unbeatable! Truly unbeatable! The editor which is part of Screenflow is actually easier to use and seems to have more functionality than iMovie which is the main reason I've used it for the past 3 years. It's on the upper scale in terms of price but it's worth the investment for a great piece of software. http://www.telestream.net/screen-flow/overview.htm (don't let their crap website put you off)
Screenflow is tops.
https://convore.com/apple/best-screencasting-software/
Free and good? Quicktime ;)
Screeflow rocks yo
Jing is great if you want to record just one window.  Quicktime can be incredibly high quality.
Try Voila, you can get it from the mac app store
